intro: Ononis natrix subsp. ramosissima, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks.
